title: Selectors
content: CSS selectors define the HTML elements to which styles will be applied.

quiz.question: Which selector targets an element with id 'header'?

title: Box Model
content: The CSS box model describes the design and layout of elements, including margins, borders, padding, and the content itself.

quiz.question: Which property adds space inside an element, just around the content?

title: Flexbox
content: Flexbox is a one-dimensional layout method for laying out items in rows or columns.

quiz.question: Which property aligns items in a Flexbox container vertically when the flex-direction is row?

title: Positioning
content: CSS positioning properties are used to position an element in a specific place against a reference.

quiz.question: Which positioning type is used to position an element relative to its normal position?

title: Media Queries
content: Media queries are used in CSS to apply styles to different media types and conditions.

quiz.question: Which media feature is used to apply styles for screens smaller than 600px?

title: Pseudo-classes
content: Pseudo-classes allow the definition of special states of an element.

quiz.question: Which pseudo-class is used to style elements when they are hovered over?

title: Transitions
content: CSS transitions are used to define a change in a property's value over a duration.

quiz.question: Which property is necessary to define a transition's duration?

title: Animations
content: CSS animations make it possible to animate transitions from one CSS style configuration to another.

quiz.question: What is the keyframe declaration used in CSS animations?

title: Gradients
content: CSS gradients let you display smooth transitions between two or more specified colors.

quiz.question: Which function is used to create a linear gradient in CSS?

title: Responsive Design
content: Responsive design uses CSS and HTML to make web pages look good on all devices.

quiz.question: Which CSS property introduces flexibility to layout design, allowing blocks to adjust to screen size?
